subject: Personal Finance
title: Life Without Credit
description: A quick win: understand Life Without Credit.

hook.text: Millions of Americans are 'credit invisible' â€” no credit history at all. It locks many doors.

buildup.text: About 26 million US adults have no credit file. Another 19 million have files too thin to score.

discovery.text: Without a score, renting an apartment, getting a phone plan, or buying a car becomes far harder.

twist.text: Immigrants, young adults, and low-income communities are disproportionately credit invisible.

climax.text: New models using rent and utility payments aim to score people without traditional credit histories.

punchline.text: No credit history is almost worse than bad credit.

quiz.question: How many US adults are 'credit invisible'?
